alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Louisa; Muscatine; Van Buren; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 11:32AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, west central Mercer, Henry, Des Moines, Van Buren, Louisa, southeastern Washington, south central Muscatine, Jefferson, northwestern Lee, northern Scotland and northwestern Clark Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1131 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oquawka to near Pilot Grove to 6 miles north of Downing. Movement was north to northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Salem around 1150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hillsboro, Toolesboro, Morning Sun, Amber, Stockport, Westwood, Wapello, Rome, Lockridge, Grandview, Fairfield, Columbus Junction, Columbus City, Letts and Maharishi Vedic City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Louisa; Muscatine; Van Buren; Washington
